bill.title: To extend for one year the program for priority review to encourage treatments for rare pediatric diseases.
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GRAYSON:H.R. 6347.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, of the United States Constitution.[Page H6301]

item.title: To extend for one year the program for priority review to encourage treatments for rare pediatric diseases.
To extend for one year the program for priority review to encourage treatments for rare pediatric diseases.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.text: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to extend through 2017 the priority review voucher program for treatments for rare pediatric diseases. (A priority review voucher is a transferable voucher that entitles the holder to have a new drug or biological product application acted upon by the Food and Drug Administration within six months.)
item.name: Introduced in House

item.latestTitle: To extend for two years the program for priority review to encourage treatments for rare pediatric diseases.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
